Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class handles the state of the player.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

    Default constructor

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addCardToBench(Card cardToAdd)
    The addCardToBench method takes one card and adds it to the player's bench.
    void
    addCardToDiscard(Card cardToBeAdded)
    The addCardToDiscard adds the given card from the player's playing space and adds it to the discardPile.

    The addCardToHand method takes one card from the deck and adds it to the player hand.

    addPrizeCardToHand()
    the addPrizeCardToHand method adds one card from the prize deck into the player's hand.
    void
    battlePhase(Player defendingPlayer)
    The battlePhase method handles the battling stage of the game.
    void
    createHand()
    The createHand method creates a new hand of 7 cards for a player.
    void
    displayPlayerStats()
    The displayPlayerStats method prints out the current statistics for a player, including, number of prize cards left in their prize deck, the current active pokemon, the HP of their active pokemon, the cards they have in their hand, the pokemon in their bench and the current number of cards they have left in their deck.

    The displayPlayerStatsNoActive displays the player's stats when they have no active Pokemon.

    The pickPokemonFromBench method allows the player to pick a pokemon from their bench, typically after their active pokemon has been knocked out.

    The pickPrizeDeck method picks a prize deck of 6 cards for the player.

    The removeCardFromHand method removes the given card from the hand of the player.
    void
    retreatActivePokemon()
    The retreatActivePokemon method checks to see if the active pokemon can be retreated to the bench, moves the active pokemon back to the bench, and then allows the player to pick a new pokemon from their bench to take the old active pokemon's place.

    • createHand

      public void createHand()
      The createHand method creates a new hand of 7 cards for a player.

      public void pickPrizeDeck()
      The pickPrizeDeck method picks a prize deck of 6 cards for the player.

    • removeCardFromHand

      public void removeCardFromHand(Card cardToBeRemoved)
      The removeCardFromHand method removes the given card from the hand of the player.
      Parameters:
      cardToBeRemoved - The card to be removed from the players hand.

    • removeCardFromBench

      public void removeCardFromBench(Card cardToBeRemoved)
      The removeCardFromBench method removes a card from the bench.
      Parameters:
      cardToBeRemoved - The card to be removed from the bench.

    • addCardToDiscard

      public void addCardToDiscard(Card cardToBeAdded)
      The addCardToDiscard adds the given card from the player's playing space and adds it to the discardPile.
      Parameters:
      cardToBeAdded - The card to be added to the discard pile.

    • addCardToHand

      public void addCardToHand()
      The addCardToHand method takes one card from the deck and adds it to the player hand.

    • addPrizeCardToHand

      public void addPrizeCardToHand()
      the addPrizeCardToHand method adds one card from the prize deck into the player's hand.

    • addCardToBench

      public void addCardToBench(Card cardToAdd)
      The addCardToBench method takes one card and adds it to the player's bench.
      Parameters:
      cardToAdd - The pokemon card to add to the player's bench.

    • isKnockedOut

      public boolean isKnockedOut()
      The isKnockedOut method checks to see if this player's active pokemon is knocked out.
      Returns:
      true - if the pokemon has no HP left, false - if the pokemon still has some HP left

    • getPlayerName

      public String getPlayerName()
      Getter for the player name variable
      Returns:
      The name of the player

    • setPlayerName

      public void setPlayerName(String playerName)
      Setter for the player name variable
      Parameters:
      playerName - The new name for the player

    • displayPlayerStats

      public void displayPlayerStats()
      The displayPlayerStats method prints out the current statistics for a player, including, number of prize cards left in their prize deck, the current active pokemon, the HP of their active pokemon, the cards they have in their hand, the pokemon in their bench and the current number of cards they have left in their deck.

    • runPlayerTurn

      public void runPlayerTurn(boolean firstTurnCheck)
      The runPlayerTurn method allows the player to run through their turn. This includes putting pokemon on their bench, attaching energies, and using trainer cards.
      Parameters:
      firstTurnCheck - A boolean variable to see if it is the first turn of the game

    • displayPlayerStatsNoActive

      public void displayPlayerStatsNoActive()
      The displayPlayerStatsNoActive displays the player's stats when they have no active Pokemon. This method is used for specific cases, such as when the player first begins the game and has no Pokemon or when the player has a Pokemon that gets knocked out due to battle.

    • noActivePokemon

      public void noActivePokemon()
      The noActivePokemon method prints out the current stats for a player and handles when the player does not have an active pokemon. This method is different from noActivePokemonFromBench because this method allows the player to pick from their hand, typically reserved for beginning of game activities.

    • noActivePokemonFromBench

      public void noActivePokemonFromBench()
      The noActivePokemonFromBench method displays the player's current stats and makes them choose a new pokemon from their bench. This method does this after a player's activePokemon has been knocked out.

    • battlePhase

      public void battlePhase(Player defendingPlayer)
      The battlePhase method handles the battling stage of the game. It asks the user which attack they would like to use and then checks if it is a valid choice (pokemon has enough energies).
      Parameters:
      defendingPlayer - The player who is defending.

    • retreatActivePokemon

      public void retreatActivePokemon()
      The retreatActivePokemon method checks to see if the active pokemon can be retreated to the bench, moves the active pokemon back to the bench, and then allows the player to pick a new pokemon from their bench to take the old active pokemon's place.

    • pickPokemonFromBench

      public void pickPokemonFromBench()
      The pickPokemonFromBench method allows the player to pick a pokemon from their bench, typically after their active pokemon has been knocked out.

    • useCard

      public void useCard(Card cardToUse)
      The useCard method uses a card of the player's choice.
      Parameters:
      cardToUse - The card the player wants to use
